go_data.justification: ERF6 functions as a transcriptional activator and suppressor of genes in response to various abiotic stresses.
ERF6 functions as a transcriptional activator and suppressor of genes in response to various abiotic stresses.
ERF6 affects the expression of abiotic stress response genes.
ERF6 is thought to be involved in tolerance to osmotic stress.
ERF6 is thought to be involved in tolerance to abiotic stress regulated by reactive oxygen species (ROS).
MPK3/MPK6-mediated phosphorylation stabilizes ERF6 and enables its targeting to the nucleus.
